title: SVG not handing <g> tag attributes correctly.
body:
Example SVG:
```
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
 <defs>
  <linearGradient id="colorSea"><stop offset="0" stop-color="#C7E6FC"/></linearGradient>
  <linearGradient id="colorForest"><stop offset="0" stop-color="#CCE699"/></linearGradient>
  <linearGradient id="colorForestBorder"><stop offset="0" stop-color="#66CC00"/></linearGradient>
 </defs>
 <rect x="0" y="0" height="1000" width="1000" fill="url(#colorSea)"/>
 <g id="forests" fill="url(#colorForest)">
  <polygon points="0,0 0,500 500,500 500,000"/>
  <g id="forestBorder" stroke="url(#colorForestBorder)">
   <line x1="000" y1="000" x2="000" y2="500"/>
   <line x1="000" y1="500" x2="500" y2="500"/>
   <line x1="500" y1="500" x2="500" y2="000"/>
   <line x1="500" y1="000" x2="000" y2="000"/>
  </g>
 </g>
</svg>
```

The polygon should get the attribute `fill="url(#colorForest)"` and the lines should get the attributes `fill="url(#colorForest)" stroke="url(#colorForestBorder)"`
g attributes should propagate down.

Expected as rendered in webbrowser on the left, actual SkiaSharp on the right

![firefox_2020-08-09_21-10-13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3768165/89739895-bbd41c80-da84-11ea-8167-fb81cc85607f.png)
